title: Question 19
prompt:
Sentence 4: Our firm has never had a formal dress code for employees, and it is important, to define a clear policy on this issue.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of this sentence? If the original is the best way, choose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
Commas should be used only when they are necessary. Some common uses of commas are to divide items in a series or list, before a conjunction separating two independent clauses, between adjectives of equal importance, around an appositive, within a date, before a quotation, or after an introductory phrase. The comma in this phrase, though, is unnecessary and should be deleted.


Our firm has never had a formal dress code for employees, and it is important to define a clear policy on this issue.
